result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhonda Lashawn Thomas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rhonda Lashawn Thomas in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Rhonda Lashawn Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense is requesting an adjournment to discuss further with the State. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rhonda Lashawn Thomas in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Rhonda Lashawn Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court vacates stayed warrant. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer and requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Rhonda Lashawn Thomas
Current: 3641 N 14th Street - Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2022)
Prior: 4754 North 57th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Rhonda Lashawn Thomas not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Rhonda Lashawn Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear. Court set calendar call. Court orders bench warrant, however stays the issue until the next court date. Case adjourned in Branch 30.
Calendar call scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Rhonda Lashawn Thomas in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court cancelled stayed bench warrant. 
Defendant may qualify for public defender representation. Case passed to allow time for defendant to contact SPD office.
Case recalled at 2:38pm. Defendant DOES qualify for public defender representation. Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rhonda Lashawn Thomas not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. 
Case adjourned to Br. 30.  Calendar call scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-26-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohls Department Store.

Defendant Rhonda Lashawn Thomas in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-24-2022 @2:30p
